CatDescriptText: Miss Cora White, 2339 Reed Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 11, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that permitting children to work after school hours is detrimental to their general welfare--Health, school, and recreational time, etc?" answer reads: "I don't think that kids should work after school. We never did when we grew up.  That way, we h ave more time for our homework which is more important than holding down a part time job."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Cora White wearing light colored coat with large tie at collar, standing with hands clasped on sidewalk of residential street
